intro: Irenea gracile, commonly known as the slender irenea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, and it has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
